sentence noun [C]
(PUNISHMENT)
B2 a punishment given by a judge in court to a person or organization after they have been found guilty of doing something wrong: He got a heavy/light sentence (= he was severely/not severely punished). The offence carries a jail/prison/life/five-year sentence. He was given a non-custodial/suspended sentence. pronounce sentence
(of a judge) to say officially what a punishment will be: pronounce sentence on The judge will pronounce sentence on the defendant this afternoon.
